reviews.review_msg: I really like Catherine. She's a nice, enthusiastic person. In terms of her teaching, I never really paid attention to lecture, but from whenever I decided to chime in, she never just read her notes. She would address real-world problems and made an effort to make them as current as possible, and she succeeded. She's really understanding, too!

She is a nice lady and is passionate about broadcasting however it is painful to sit through her lectures because she does not make it understandable and goes on and on. She will often times try to conclude her speech but then concludes her concluding speech with another concluding speech. Prepare to feel overwhelmed.
Best class I've taken in this department, hands down. Great method of teaching.

Don't take a class with her. I took a lower division course and it was fine, but once you hit upper division she turns into a savage with the smaller class size. Seems nice on the surface but will absolutely rip you to shreds if you misunderstand something. Very tough grader. Super condescending.

Definitely not a GPA booster, but that's to be expected given the material. I did find her lectures a bit long and slide heavy. However, I think she did a good job with a dry topic, and she was one of the most caring profs I've ever had. Reached out to me when I was struggling at the end of the semester and worked with me to make sure I passed.
She is very strict and brings this vibe of fear instead of passion into the classroom.

I took 230 and 333 with Sarah and liked both of her classes. She did an amazing job moving 333 online. I saw her responding to questions on on Slack during all day and night times, and her comments kept me motivated as I had to finish my project remotely. She does not give exeptions and extensions easily, but I think that is fair.
Loved this course. Sarah is a great Prof and very patient. I did not expect broadcast policy to be interesting, but turns out it is.
